thread.section_title: Theater Review News | Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Wasting Away at ‘Margaritaville’ Drinking Game

author: Terry Teachout
title: Wasting Away at ‘Margaritaville’ Drinking Game
text:
New York
The jukebox musical, in which the back catalog of a songwriter and/or pop star is repurposed as the score to a stage show, is one of Broadway’s staple items. Rarely are such shows any good, but some have been hits, and hope springs eternal in the cash-hungry hearts of theatrical producers and superannuated rockers. That’s why “Escape to Margaritaville,” whose score consists of 26 songs by Jimmy Buffett, has arrived on Broadway after preliminary runs in La Jolla, Calif., and Chicago, Houston and New Orleans. Even...
